intro: Phyllanthus scaber var. pallidiflorus, commonly known as the paleflower sandmat, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and small, pale yellow flowers. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine, stiff hairs. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. This plant is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
